docs.lead_paragraph: Amid the accusations of Deflategate, his image has been tarnished. But how much will it really matter?

headline.main: Assessing Tom Brady’s Stock in the Fashion World

docs.abstract: Vanessa Friedman says New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady's image will recover from deflated football scandal.
docs.snippet: Amid the accusations of Deflategate, his image has been tarnished. But how much will it really matter?

docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's anti-fraud agency has launched an investigation into business and accounting practices at insurance claims processor Quindell, it said on Wednesday, as the company announced a 238 million pound ($372 million) loss for 2014.

headline.main: UK Anti-Fraud Agency to Investigate Claims Firm Quindell
headline.print_headline: UK Anti-Fraud Agency to Investigate Claims Firm Quindell

docs.snippet: Britain's anti-fraud agency has launched an investigation into business and accounting practices at insurance claims processor Quindell, it said on Wednesday, as the company announced a 238 million pound ($372 million) loss for 2014.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mary Beth Jachec lives in a three-bedroom house in Wauconda, a village of 14,000 in Illinois, 45 miles northwest of Chicago. Her semi-detached brick home is unassuming. Her tax bills are not.

headline.main: Special Report: Multitude of Local Authorities Soak Illinois Homeowners in Taxes
headline.print_headline: Special Report: Multitude of Local Authorities Soak Illinois Homeowners in Taxes

docs.lead_paragraph: Mississippi Republican Gov. Phil Bryant has $2.8 million in his campaign fund, and his Democratic challenger in the November election is a truck driver who reported spending no money so far and who said he didn't even vote in Tuesday's primary.

headline.main: Truck Driver Wins Dem Nomination for Mississippi Governor
headline.print_headline: Truck Driver Wins Dem Nomination for Mississippi Governor

docs.snippet: Mississippi Republican Gov. Phil Bryant has $2.8 million in his campaign fund, and his Democratic challenger in the November election is a truck driver who reported spending no money so far and who said he didn't even vote in Tuesday's primary.

docs.lead_paragraph: The aid agencies, including the W.H.O., need $60.9 million to operate their health care centers in Iraq but have received only $5.1 million from donors.

headline.main: Iraq: Funding Shortfall Deprives Uprooted Iraqis of Health Services
headline.print_headline: Middle East; Iraq: Funding Shortfall Deprives Uprooted Iraqis of Health Services

docs.abstract: World Health Organization and other international aid agencies suspend 84 percent of their health programs in 10 Iraqi provinces due to gap in donations; says shortfall deprives basic health care for nearly three million people.
docs.snippet: The aid agencies, including the W.H.O., need $60.9 million to operate their health care centers in Iraq but have received only $5.1 million from donors.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Travelers Cos. Inc. said Tuesday that Chairman and CEO Jay S. Fishman will step down as CEO on Dec. 1 due to health problems. The company said Alan D. Schnitzer, head of the insurance company's business and international insurance unit, will succeed Fishman as CEO.

headline.main: Travelers CEO to Step Down in December, Cites Health Issues
headline.print_headline: Travelers CEO to Step Down in December, Cites Health Issues

docs.lead_paragraph: About 1.8 million households that got financial help for health insurance under President Barack Obama's law now have issues with their tax returns that could jeopardize their subsidies next year. Administration officials say those taxpayers will have to act quickly.

headline.main: Tax Filing Problems Could Jeopardize Health Law Aid for 1.8M

docs.lead_paragraph: Aetna Inc on Tuesday reported a better-than-expected adjusted net profit for the second quarter and said "moderate" medical costs boosted the profitability of its government Medicare and Medicaid plans.

headline.main: Aetna Profit Beats as Moderate Medical Costs Help Government Plans
headline.print_headline: Aetna Profit Beats as Moderate Medical Costs Help Government Plans

docs.snippet: Aetna Inc on Tuesday reported a better-than-expected adjusted net profit for the second quarter and said "moderate" medical costs boosted the profitability of its government Medicare and Medicaid plans.

docs.lead_paragraph: For most of the 3,000 inhabitants of the "Jungle", a shanty town on the sand dunes of France's north coast, the climax of each day is the nightly bid to sneak into the undersea tunnel they hope will lead to new life in Britain.

headline.main: The 'Jungle' Migrants of Calais: a Day in the Life
headline.print_headline: The 'Jungle' Migrants of Calais: a Day in the Life

docs.snippet: For most of the 3,000 inhabitants of the "Jungle", a shanty town on the sand dunes of France's north coast, the climax of each day is the nightly bid to sneak into the undersea tunnel they hope will lead to new life in Britain.
